Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (partly worn); trace of band of single short vertical strokes in added white between white bands; below, dot rosette and lotus bud in added white and added red between red and white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion to left (part of underbelly, haunch and hind legs remaining; red on underbelly, haunch and hind leg); at right, part of haunch and hind leg of second lion with red on haunch to right; squared crosses as filling ornament; below, part of square and billet pattern band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1595) (phase 2)
